channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China's premier defends national competitiveness as trade tensions simmer
item.description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang on Tuesday defended the country's technological development while criticizing efforts to restrict global cooperation.

item.title: Tech giants bet next-generation optical networks will reduce AI's climate impact, aid 6G transition
item.description: The likes of Microsoft, Google, Intel, and Sony are working together on photonic networks, which use light rather than electrical impulses to deliver data.

item.title: Nvidia slides 13% in three days after briefly becoming most valuable company
item.description: Nvidia shares fell 6.7% on Monday, the chipmaker's third down day in a row, and the stock is now off 13% from its peak last week.

item.title: He's only 28 but has revitalized France's far right: Meet the man who could be the country's next prime minister
item.description: Marine Le Pen's protégé, Jordan Bardella, could be thrust into one of the most powerful role in French politics.

item.title: Oracle warns that a TikTok ban would hurt business
item.description: Oracle provides cloud services to TikTok, and is warning investors that a ban of the app could hurt the company's revenue.

item.title: Asia-Pacific markets mostly gain after U.S. tech sell-off pushes key Wall Street indexes lower
item.description: Investors in Asia will assess South Korea's consumer sentiment index for June, as well as Japan's service sector producer prices.

item.title: 34-year-old making $400,000 at TikTok: Being let go from Meta in 2022 was 'perfect timing'
item.description: Sora Lee didn't plan on going into tech after college. Here's what she's learned working at Netflix, Meta and TikTok, and how much money she's made.

item.title: China employing 'gray zone tactics' at contested Second Thomas Shoal, Lowy Institute's Yaacob says
item.description: China is employing “gray zone tactics” against the Philippines in contested waters as it avoids wider conflict with the U.S., according to one expert.

item.title: Ferrari CEO says all-electric model preserves the 'emotion' of the famed supercars
item.description: Ferrari is opening a new E-Building in Maranello, Italy, that will produce internal combustion engine cars alongside hybrid and all-electric models.

item.title: Fast fashion retailer Shein confidentially files for London IPO as U.S. listing stalls
item.description: Shein confidentially filed for a U.S. initial public offering late in 2023, but the retailer has faced mounting backlash.

item.title: China wants EU to scrap planned higher tariffs and 'abide by WTO rules,' state media reports
item.description: Scrapping the tariff decision on Chinese EVs is set to benefit both sides, Global Times reported, quoting observers.

item.title: Southeast Asia is a top choice for firms diversifying supply chains amid U.S.-China tensions
item.description: Rising tensions between Washington and Beijing have led firms to diversify supply chains away from China even as they maintain a presence in the country.

item.title: Singaporean swimmer Toh Wei Soong hopes for a medal in his second Paralympic bid
item.description: Singaporean para-athlete Toh Wei Soong will be fighting to medal in the Paralympics this year in Paris.

item.title: Bitcoin tumbles below $60,000 to start the week
item.description: The cryptocurrency has been stuck between $60,000 and $70,000 since March.

item.title: South Korea plant fire kills 22 people after lithium battery combustion
item.description: A fire that broke out at a South Korean lithium battery plant has killed 22 people, local officials said

item.title: OpenAI walks back controversial stock sale policies, will treat current and former employees the same
item.description: After facing pressure from stakeholders, OpenAI last week informed current and former employees about changes to its rules regarding tender offers.

item.title: Novo Nordisk to build $4.1 billion North Carolina facility to boost output of Wegovy, Ozempic
item.description: The new plant in Clayton, North Carolina, will be responsible for filling and packaging syringes and injection pens for Wegovy, Ozempic and other drugs.

item.title: Paramount+ to increase prices for its streaming plans
item.description: Paramount Global's streaming service Paramount+ will raise prices for its plans after its merger plan with Skydance fell through.

item.title: Disney's 'Inside Out 2' could be the first billion-dollar movie of 2024
item.description: Disney and Pixar's "Inside Out 2" is the highest-grossing film of 2024 and soon could be the first since Warner Bros.' "Barbie" to surpass $1 billion globally.

item.title: Trump Media stock soars 21%, breaking weekslong decline in DJT share price
item.description: Trump Media stock value had fallen by nearly 50% in the weeks since former President Donald Trump was found guilty of falsifying business records.

item.title: Betting scandal inside the UK's ruling Conservative Party mars election race
item.description: A number of officials in Britain's ruling Conservative party have been accused of using inside knowledge to win bets on the date of the general election.

item.title: UK's Farage accused of 'Kremlin propaganda' after claiming the West provoked Ukraine invasion
item.description: Populist British politician Nigel Farage has doubled down on claims that the West provoked Russia's invasion of Ukraine despite facing backlash from Westminster.

item.title: European Union regulators accuse Apple of breaching the bloc's tech rules
item.description: Apple's App Store practices have been in the crosshairs of European Union regulators this year.

item.title: Human rights lawyer to political reformer: Who is Keir Starmer, the UK's new would-be prime minister
item.description: Labour leader Keir Starmer is the favorite to win the U.K.'s July 4 election.

item.title: Four self-made millionaires echo the same advice for success: Just get started
item.description: Jason McGowan, Anne Mahlum, Edward Tirtanata and Shawn Tsao have one thing in common — they're millionaire founders willing to sacrifice everything for a dream.

item.title: 'Intense' stage of Gaza fighting is close to end, Israel's Netanyahu says
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has signaled that the "intense" phase of fighting in the war-torn Gaza enclosure is close to ending.

item.title: Nvidia-backed AI startup Synthesia now lets you make multilingual video presentations using just your phone or webcam
item.description: AI startup Synthesia debuted a slew of new features including the ability to make Apple-style presentations with avatars by using just a webcam or phone.

item.title: Nvidia remains a little-known brand despite briefly passing Apple, Microsoft in market cap
item.description: Even with its ascent past $3 trillion in market cap, Nvidia is far from a household name.

item.title: Experts say Shein's U.S. IPO is all but dead
item.description: Chances for a U.S. IPO for Shein are veering toward near-zero as American public officials take a tougher bipartisan stance on Chinese e-commerce platforms.

item.title: The stock market is in its longest stretch without a 2% sell-off since the financial crisis
item.description: Wall Street's rise to record highs has come with very little volatility.
